name: Rhys Shaw
summary: Final year Astrophysics PhD Student at the University of Bristol, with a experience in Machine Learning, Data Analysis and software engineering.

work_experience.description: Worked on building a internal LLM client tool. This interacted with any LLM API, stored all data locally and allowed for attaching relevant documents from local the network. This required building a full-stack web application, for which we used FastAPI, HTMX for website front and backend. All data was held within a MongoDB.

Lab demonstration, assisting 2nd year undergraduates in completing their research projects. This required a detailed working knowledge of a number of physics experiements. I then accesed them through interviews and marking reports.

education.thesis: Machine Learning and Analysis Techniques for Extra-Galactic Sources.
The Effect of fractal substructure in early stellar cluster evolution.
Exploring the bias in X-ray and SZ selected galaxy clusters using scaling relations.

experience.title: DataAid Commitee Member
experience.description: DataAid is a yearly student-led hackathon that aims to provide data science support to charities and non-profit organizations. As a committee member, I am responsible for helping to organize events, selecting charities that we are able to help on a technical level, as well as providing technical support to the hackathon.

experience.title: Astrophysics Developer Group co-Lead
experience.description: I am co-lead of the Astrophysics Developer Group at the University of Bristol. This an open group of PhD students and Academics that meet weekly to discuss software development in their research. This includes discussing wins and issues that are coding related with a small talk/tutorial each week about a specific topic. I have given talks on basic Web-developement, parallelisation and self-hosting.

awards.name: AIMLAC CDT PhD Studentship
awards.description: Awarded a fully funded PhD studentship from the AIMLAC CDT at the University of Bristol.

awards.name: BSc Research Project Commendation
awards.description: Commendation for my BSc research project on the bias in X-ray and SZ selected galaxy clusters using galaxy cluster scaling relations.

projects.name: Stilts-nli
projects.description: A Natural Langauge interface to the Astrophysics software STILTS. This project consists of a cli user interface that makes calls to a finetuned open-source langauge model.

projects.name: DRUID
projects.description: One of my PhD projects, DRUID is a python package that preforms source finding on astronomical images using persistent homology.

projects.name: Personal Website
projects.description: My personal website, built using FastAPI and HTMX hosted on my self-hosted server.
